status-website.blurb: Define high-level project tasks as upgrades in a skill tree, rendered as a website (the one you're looking at right now)

chronological-project-status.blurb: Render game upgrades in a timeline to view project velocity/history

categorical-project-status.blurb: Render game upgrades by category, to assess balance

pretty-status-website.blurb: Make the project status website look like the Github or Spacex website to impress newcomers

planar-skill-tree.display-name: Remove Edge Crossings from Skill Tree
planar-skill-tree.blurb: Implement a planar graph drawing algorithm from Tutte (1962) and Hopcroft and Tarjan (1974)

command-prompt.blurb: Developers can write CLI tools used inside of ROBLOX games

command-windows.blurb: Open/close multiple tabs or windows of command prompts

user-testing.blurb: Write tests that any user can play and verify using the command line

devops-status.blurb: Send error reports to a discord channel to find bugs

rcss.blurb: Separate UI appearance / styling code from functional code

beta-deployments.blurb: Deploy new features to only a single server to test for bugs

discord-community.blurb: Gather a following of friends and family to help test my game

mvp.blurb: Build a prototype with the core functionality of the game and test if it's fun.

character-animations.blurb: When characters walk, jump, fall, or sit still, they are animated with spritesheets

character-health.blurb: Players can see their own health and when characters take damage

day-night-cycle.blurb: Suns are visible in the skies of worlds, relative to the orientation of the world and the character's position

starry-skies.blurb: Night skies are filled with stars

first-solar-system.blurb: A set of planets, moons, and asteroids orbiting a single star

lobby.blurb: Players spawn in a space station, where they join ship crews

camera-tracking.blurb: The player's camera can track a moving object in any environment

character-controls.blurb: Players can spawn a character they control with keyboard/mouse

mobile-character-controls.blurb: Players can control characters on mobile devices

xbox-character-controls.blurb: Players can control characters on the xbox

world-environment.blurb: The game can save/load round 2d worlds, which are a collection of blocks and air

ship-environment.blurb: The game can save/load flat 2d rooms, which are a collection of blocks and air

moving-objects.blurb: The game can save/load objects that feel gravity & collide with blocks

gravitational-stability.blurb: Stable celestial bodies are guaranteed not to crash into each other and create a mess

characters.blurb: The game can spawn characters, which die, respawn, move, and jump

proximity-prompt.blurb: Characters can walk up to button blocks & press them

doors.blurb: Characters can walk into / out of ships/buildings, which have a bigger, separate environment on the 'inside'

meteors.blurb: Objects can enter worlds from space, and vice versa

spaceships.blurb: Characters can fly spaceships between worlds

basic-autopilot.blurb: Spaceships can automatically fly to destination world coordinates or orbital paths

advanced-autopilot.blurb: Spaceship autopilot actively avoids crashing into other moving objects

spaceship-lifecycle.blurb: Spaceships can be destroyed, and respawn at the lobby

keybinds.blurb: Players can change which buttons do what controls

leaderboard.blurb: Players can see who else is playing with them
